docs.title: VoiceAssist Documentation Style Guide
docs.summary: Writing standards for VoiceAssist documentation
docs.aiSummary: This guide establishes consistent writing standards for all VoiceAssist documentation, ensuring clarity for both human readers and AI agents. Every markdown document MUST include frontmatter: --- title: Document Title (required) status: draft|experimental|stable|deprecated (required) lastUpdated:...

docs.title: Feature Flags Overview
docs.summary: Comprehensive guide to VoiceAssist feature flag system
docs.aiSummary: Feature flags enable runtime feature toggling without deployments. Use category.feature_name pattern (e.g., ui.dark_mode, backend.rag_strategy). Flags stored in PostgreSQL, cached in Redis (5min TTL).

docs.title: Feature Flags Admin Panel Guide
docs.summary: Using the Admin Panel to manage feature flags
docs.aiSummary: Admin Panel at admin.asimo.io provides UI for flag management. Navigate to Settings > Feature Flags. Toggle, edit percentage, filter by category. Real-time updates via SSE. Requires admin JWT.

docs.title: Advanced Feature Flag Types
docs.summary: Boolean, percentage, variant, and scheduled feature flag types
docs.aiSummary: Four flag types available - boolean (on/off), percentage (gradual rollout 0-100%), variant (A/B/C testing), scheduled (time-based activation). Use percentage for safe rollouts, variant for A/B tests.

docs.title: Feature Flag Best Practices
docs.summary: Guidelines for effective feature flag usage
docs.aiSummary: Keep flags temporary (remove after stable rollout). Use descriptive names. Start with 10% rollouts. Always have rollback plan. Review flags quarterly. Document in code and commit messages.

docs.title: Feature Flag Lifecycle
docs.summary: Managing feature flags from creation to retirement
docs.aiSummary: Flags go through 4 stages - creation (disabled), testing (dev/staging), rollout (gradual %), retirement (cleanup). Always start disabled, test in non-prod, use percentage rollouts, clean up after 100% stable.

docs.title: Multi-Environment Feature Flags
docs.summary: Managing feature flags across dev, staging, and production environments
docs.aiSummary: Flags have per-environment states. Dev flags auto-enable, staging mirrors prod with overrides, prod requires explicit enablement. Use Redis namespaced keys (flags:dev:name, flags:prod:name).

docs.title: Feature Flag Naming Conventions
docs.summary: Standards for naming feature flags in VoiceAssist
docs.aiSummary: Use category.feature_name pattern. Categories are ui, backend, admin, integration, experiment, ops. Use snake_case for feature names. Never use hyphens or the deprecated ff_ prefix.

docs.title: System Settings vs Feature Flags
docs.summary: Understanding when to use configuration settings vs feature flags
docs.aiSummary: Use system settings for permanent config (API_TIMEOUT, DATABASE_URL). Use feature flags for temporary toggles (new features, A/B tests, gradual rollouts). Settings need deployment to change; flags change at runtime.

docs.title: Feature Flags
docs.summary: Runtime feature toggling and configuration management system
docs.aiSummary: Feature flags enable runtime toggles without deployments. Use category.feature_name pattern (e.g., ui.dark_mode, backend.rag_strategy). Stored in PostgreSQL, cached in Redis (5min TTL). See admin-guide/feature-flags/ for detailed docs.

docs.title: Next Phase Improvements
docs.summary: Roadmap and tracking for documentation improvements and AI-friendly enhancements
docs.aiSummary: Tracks documentation improvements across sprints. Sprint 1 (accessibility, monitoring) complete. Sprint 2 (HelpTooltip, validation) complete. Sprint 3 (versioning, CODEOWNERS, i18n) in planning. Priority TODOs include adding ai_summary to more docs.

docs.title: Unified Chat/Voice UI Implementation
docs.summary: Implementation guide for the merged Chat and Voice Mode interface with seamless mode switching.
docs.aiSummary: Unified Chat/Voice UI merges text and voice interfaces. Feature flag ui.unified_chat_voice controls enablement. Three-panel layout with collapsible sidebar and context pane. Uses Zustand for state management.

docs.title: World-Class Voice Barge-In Implementation Plan
docs.summary: Transform VoiceAssist voice mode to human-like conversation with <30ms speech detection, intelligent interruptions, and natural turn-taking.
docs.aiSummary: Voice barge-in system enables human-like interruption handling. Features neural VAD (<30ms detection), context-aware interruptions, full duplex audio, and adaptive personalization. Implementation complete across 10 phases.

docs.title: Admin Panel Integration Guide
docs.summary: Comprehensive guide for the VoiceAssist admin panel with cross-app navigation, real-time events, and voice monitoring
docs.aiSummary: Admin panel integrates cross-app navigation, real-time event streaming via WebSocket/Redis, and voice session monitoring. Provides centralized control for feature flags, knowledge base, and system health.

docs.title: Real-Time Events Guide
docs.summary: Guide to the admin panel real-time event system using WebSocket and Redis pub/sub
docs.aiSummary: Real-time events use WebSocket connections with Redis pub/sub for live updates. Supports feature flag changes, voice session events, and system health broadcasts. Auto-reconnects with exponential backoff.

docs.title: Documentation Guide for AI Agents
docs.summary: Guide for AI agents on how to navigate and use VoiceAssist documentation effectively
docs.aiSummary: AI agents should use /agent/*.json endpoints for structured data. Start with index.json for available endpoints, docs-summary.json for quick context, health.json for documentation status. Use ai_summary fields in frontmatter for quick understanding.
